title: How to Lose Weight from Your Cheeks

steps.title: Say “X” and “O” back-to-back.
steps.content: Say “X” and “O” back-to-back. Repeating these sounds can help to work the muscles in your cheeks and create a slimmer looking face. Say each letter 20 times and repeat this twice daily. [1] X Research source You can do these facial exercises in the shower, while getting dressed in the morning, or during your morning commute. Keep in mind that there isn’t definitive evidence that facial exercises can get rid of excess weight in your cheeks. Some people believe that these exercises can tone your facial muscles and therefore make your face look slimmer, but this hasn’t been scientifically proven. [2] X Trustworthy Source Harvard Medical School Harvard Medical School's Educational Site for the Public Go to source However, one small 2018 study involving a group of 16 women did suggest that facial exercises improved overall facial appearance and muscle strength, so it’s possible that they may have some benefit, and they certainly won’t hurt. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Suck in your cheeks like a fish.
steps.content: Suck in your cheeks like a fish. Pull your cheeks into your mouth by sucking them inwards. Then, hold your cheeks in this position for about 3 seconds, and release. [4] X Research source Repeat this exercise 20 times daily.

steps.title: Open your mouth wide, hold, and relax.
steps.content: Open your mouth wide, hold, and relax. Open up your mouth as wide as you can, such as if you’re about to take a big bite of something. Then, hold it in this position for 5 seconds. Then, relax and close your mouth again. [5] X Research source Repeat this exercise 20 times daily.

steps.title: Swish air around in your mouth.
steps.content: Swish air around in your mouth. Swish the air like you would swish mouthwash. Do this for a total of 5 minutes per day. You can break it up into 1, 2 or 3 minute sessions or try to do it all at once. [6] X Research source If you prefer, you could also try swishing water around in your mouth to work your cheek muscles.

steps.title: Chew a stick of gum after each meal.
steps.content: Chew a stick of gum after each meal. The repetitive chewing motion may help to strengthen your jaw and make your cheeks look slimmer, though there isn’t definitive evidence for this. [7] X Research source Chew gum for 5 to 10 minutes after every meal. Chewing gum might also have a positive effect for a different reason. Some research suggests that it helps manage your appetite and avoid overeating. [8] X Trustworthy Source Science Direct Online archive of peer-reviewed research on scientific, technical and medical topics Go to source This may help you lose weight in general, which typically results in slimmer cheeks. If chewing gum hurts your jaw, don’t do it.

steps.title: Smile more often.
steps.content: Smile more often. The act of smiling requires your facial muscles, so some people believe that smile exercises tone these muscles. [9] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Smile without showing your teeth, then purse your lips, then smile again and force your cheek muscles upward. Next, place your fingers on the corners of your mouth, then slide them to the top of your cheeks and hold for 20 seconds. [10] X Research source There isn’t evidence that smiling can have a significant impact on your facial muscles or facial fat, but it can’t hurt. And, as an added bonus, smiling often may also help you feel more positive and confident in general. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Take it easy on the salt and sugar.
steps.content: Take it easy on the salt and sugar . If you include too much salt and refined sugar in your diet, your body is more likely to retain water. Water retention can lead to puffiness, bloating, and weight gain, so you may notice that your face and cheeks look puffier. [12] X Trustworthy Source American Heart Association Leading nonprofit that funds medical research and public education Go to source Though you can't eliminate salt and sugar from your diet completely, reducing your intake can help prevent fluid retention, and by extension, facial puffiness. [13] X Research source

steps.title: Adopt a healthy diet and cut calories to lose weight.
steps.content: Adopt a healthy diet and cut calories to lose weight. The best strategy for losing weight in your cheeks is to change your diet and work on overall weight loss. Identify your target weight and make this your goal. Then, cut back on calories by eating more healthy, low-calorie foods, such as fruits, vegetables, whole grains, and lean proteins. [14] X Expert Source Danny Gordon Certified Personal Trainer Expert Interview. 18 October 2019. Try downloading a calorie counting app to keep track of how much you’re eating each day. Record everything you eat and drink in the app and stay within your daily caloric limit to start losing weight.

steps.title: Drink more water to promote weight loss and reduce cheek puffiness.
steps.content: Drink more water to promote weight loss and reduce cheek puffiness. Water is the best thing to drink when you’re dieting, since it has no calories and it helps you to feel full between meals. Not staying well hydrated may also result in water retention, which can cause your cheeks to look puffy. Drink water whenever you are thirsty to stay well-hydrated. [15] X Research source Keep a water bottle with you at all times and refill it throughout the day. Drink extra water if you’ve been sweating excessively, such as after a workout or when you’re out in warm weather.

steps.title: Consume alcohol in moderation or avoid it.
steps.content: Consume alcohol in moderation or avoid it. Drinking alcohol may cause your cheeks to look puffy, so avoid drinking alcohol whenever you can, and only drink moderately if you do drink. [16] X Research source Moderate drinking is defined as no more than 1 alcoholic drink per day for women or 2 per day for men. [17] X Trustworthy Source Centers for Disease Control and Prevention Main public health institute for the US, run by the Dept. of Health and Human Services Go to source One drink is equal to 12 fl oz (350 mL) of beer, 5 fl oz (150 mL) of wine, or 1.5 fl oz (44 mL) of spirits. [18] X Research source Try swapping your evening cocktail for a cup of chamomile tea or a mocktail made with sparkling water and fruit juice.

steps.title: Exercise
steps.content: Exercise for 150 minutes per week to help promote weight loss. This is the recommended amount of moderate cardiovascular exercise for general well-being. Doing this amount of exercise each week will also help you to burn more calories and lose weight. You can work out for 30 minutes 5 times per week or break up your 150 minutes in a different way. [19] X Trustworthy Source MedlinePlus Collection of medical information sourced from the US National Library of Medicine Go to source If you prefer, you can do 75 minutes of vigorous exercise instead, such as running or doing high-intensity interval training. Make sure to choose a form of exercise that you enjoy, so you’ll be more likely to stick with it. For example, if you enjoy dancing, take a dance class or follow along with dance aerobics videos online. [20] X Expert Source Danny Gordon Certified Personal Trainer Expert Interview. 18 October 2019. Want other tips to slim your face? Learn what's worked for fellow readers on the wikiHow forum post, "How can I lose face fat?"

steps.title: Get more sleep to promote weight loss.
steps.content: Get more sleep to promote weight loss. Getting a good night’s sleep each night may also help to promote weight loss, so make sleep a priority. Go to bed early enough to get at least 7 hours of sleep per night. Some other strategies that may help to promote a restful night’s sleep include: [21] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source Making your bedroom a relaxing place, such as by getting a nice set of sheets and keeping it clean, cool, quiet, and dark. Turning off screens at least 30 minutes before bedtime, such as your phone, computer, and TV. Avoiding caffeine in the afternoon and evening. [22] X Trustworthy Source Harvard Medical School Harvard Medical School's Educational Site for the Public Go to source

steps.title: Ask your doctor to check for underlying conditions.
steps.content: Ask your doctor to check for underlying conditions. In some cases, puffy cheeks may indicate a medical condition that requires treatment. If you’re already at a healthy weight and nothing seems to help reduce the puffiness in your cheeks, make an appointment with a doctor. [23] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source For example, your doctor may want to check you for the mumps, Cushing syndrome, hyperthyroidism, or lupus, since these conditions can cause your cheeks to look puffy. [24] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source

steps.title: Check to see if your medications might cause puffy cheeks.
steps.content: Check to see if your medications might cause puffy cheeks. If you’re taking a prescription or over-the-counter medication regularly, this might be contributing to puffy cheeks. Check with your doctor to see if this if a possibility and if there are any alternative medications you can try. [25] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source For example, oxycodone can cause a reaction that makes your face and extremities swell up. Although this is rare, it’s worth looking into if you’re taking this medication. [26] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source The steroid prednisone may cause facial swelling for some people, as well. [27] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source

steps.title: Look into plastic surgery if other strategies don’t help.
steps.content: Look into plastic surgery if other strategies don’t help. This is an extreme option for excess weight in your cheeks, but it’s something you can consider if nothing’s helping and the excess weight bothers you. You can ask your primary care physician for a referral to a plastic surgeon or find an experienced plastic surgeon on your own. [28] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Common cosmetic procedures that address facial fat include facial liposuction, dermal fillers, Botox, and buccal fat removal. [29] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source
